And judging from other reviews, they do a terrible job handling returns so I'd suggest steering clear, unless you're feeling lucky.

The grinding quality is average - there is some inconsistency in grind but that's true for most blade grinders.
The main gripe with this grinder is the large amount of spill - even a quick few second grind and removing the lid will result in a large amount of overspill of ground coffee. There is a large gap between the lid and the walls resulting in fine coffee falling all over, making it a pain to clean after every grind. Very disappointing.

Doesnt grind very well, fine particles fall to bottom while larger ones stay on top. Grinds also work their way under the canister preventing you from grinding. Stopped using it and went back to my hand burl grinder because it works so much better. Just go buy a conical burr or a hand burr grinder for way better results.
Only gripe is when shaking the grinder to get an even grind all over, some of the product that is being ground comes out and makes a mess on the counter. Otherwise its a really good grinder

reviews.reviewTitle: There is a fundamental flaw in the design. When ...
reviews.reviewText:
There is a fundamental flaw in the design. When you press down for grinding the beans/spices, the spices spill out from the metal container and land on the black rim between the metal cup and the cover When you unlock and release the metal cup from the motor, you will find the mess everywhere.
I tried grinding cinnamon too; the blades are NOT sharp at all. Left tossing half-inch pieces without grinding them. Not worth it; go for the KRUPS grinder.
My husband makes our coffee and he grinds are beans. I bought this for him and he loves it. I love the color because it matches my kitchen decor and I also love the KitchenAid brand. Solid Buy

I love this grinder! It does everything the description said it would do. I like that I can remove the container and wash it. I can put nearly a cup of beans into it and they grind beautifully. If you want a quality grinder, buy this one, in fact I am buying one for my daughter.

Works great for ground coffee. If you are looking to do espresso, get a burr grinder. This will not grind your beans fine enough for espresso. I give it 5 stars because it is easy to use, works fast (about 12 seconds) and it is a breeze to clean. I haven't had any issues with the blades getting stuck so far (3 weeks) and I've ground several different roasts of coffee including a couple where I threw in a few chopped pecans and hazelnuts and no issues. If you are looking for a coffee grinder, this a great grinder that's easy to use and clean. It also looks nice on my counter, which doesn't factor in to my rating, just a bonus.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very efficient but hard to get all of the grinds out
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a christmas gift for friends since they drink a lot of coffee but didn't have a grinder. I use it when I make coffee at their house. It is very easy to use, can be a little loud, but it grinds the beans very quickly. The only issue for me is that it is hard to get all of the grinds out and you have to use an utensil to get everything. Other than that, it is a very good coffee grinder.

Update 2018: The place plastic has shattered and crumbled around the lid so this is no longer useful. I thought it was OK at first, but in reality, if you're going to be grinding coffee, get a real burr grinder. I've replaced this and am much happier with the real coffee grinder and the flavor is improved as well.

This is a much better design than the older grinders that you have to tip over and spill all over the kitchen then somehow clean up without water.... This one you just grind the beans and take off the cup to dump into the coffee maker. No mess.

I really like how this is set up. It's kind of like a blender (but smaller) and the whole metal cup (with its blades) is removable and easily washable. The whole set up is very well thought out. I also got the smaller spice grinder attachments?, which simply replace the metal cup to the smaller spice grinding cup.

I found this ground coffee either too course or too fine. I followed the instructions and was not happy with the way and was not happy with the way it worked. I did keep it however because it grinds my herbs and spices into a powder that I can measure more easily.

I did quite a bit of research before purchasing this coffee mill. Even the expensive brands seemed to have poor reviews and the two main complaints in those reviews (not grinding all the beans and leaving chunks, and being too messy because there was not a removable cup) are NOT an issue with this model as far as I can tell. I've owned this about three weeks and couldn't be more pleased, in fact it exceeded every expectation. When I saw the blades for the first time, I assumed it was going to also leave some chucks of unground beans in the receptacle. Never has it done that. The grind is perfectly even and fine. I was also surprised that it is relatively quiet when grinding. This unit is VERY easy to clean and not messy because the receptacle lifts out and you empty that into the coffee filter rather than turning over the whole unit. Plus, both the grinding receptacle and the lid can be washed so you could easily switch from grinding coffee beans one day to grinding some peppercorns the next. You could never do that with a coffee grinder that didn't have a lift-out receptacle that you could throw in the dishwasher because there would be residual flavor in the receptacle. I have not tried grinding spices with it, but judging on how well it works with whole coffee beans I think it would do fine. I expected to like this unit, but thought I would have some of the same issues that other folks had experienced like the receptacle being somewhat difficult to lift out, or the lid getting covered with grounds. Honestly, each time I have used it the receptacle has been a piece of cake to lift out, I've had zero trouble with that. And even when I fill the receptacle full to grind a lot of beans I have yet to get the clear lid dirty with grinds. I realize I'm praising this thing to the point where it sounds perfect, but since I love it so far I really can't think of a negative. It's attractive on the counter too.

Update June 16, 2012 : Still 100% happy with this purchase. Even when I fill the reservoir full with beans and grind a lot at once, it never leaves any unground beans. Not even a small chunk remains, there is just a perfectly smooth, fine grind. And it grinds a full reservoir extremely fast (in mere SECONDS). I've put the removable reservoir in the dishwasher several times so far, no problem. I don't wash it every day. I wash it about once a week. I've never had loose grounds on the countertop and it's never made a mess, so I'm unsure why some reviews seem to say it made a mess. I'm being fully honest that I cannot think of a single thing that I dislike about this appliance. P.S. I don't put the clear acrylic top in the dishwasher. It's never dirty so I've never washed the lid, just the stainless steel bean reservoir.

So far so good. Feels sturdy, I like the stainless cup, no more problem with static plastic cups and the coffee grinds clinging to it. I need to grind the beans 25-30 seconds twice (stirring in between) even though that is not recommended in the instructions because of temperatures affecting the flavor. But that is what it needs to get a fine, even grind for espresso. If it won't last at least 10 years, I will update the review. My mom's lasted more than twenty years!

reviews.reviewTitle: Caution Cleaning the Base Unit Required
reviews.reviewText: Needs much clearer instructions regarding cleaning the base unit. I cleaned entire unit after first grind with wet cloth. Upon second grind the unit caught fire and white smoke appeared. I was quick to stop and unplug unit however it was heating up quickly and I had to place outside to cool down. If my reaction was slower, the unit would have caught fire. I'm quite certain that some dampness from the cloth caused this therefore would highly encourage the manufacturer to explicitly outline the risks in the product manual and packaging. Otherwise, I was quite satisfied but learned from the experience.
Great product

Happy I bought this. Decent buy at a good price point. This is my first coffee grinder.

Pros: Stupid simple to use, put beans inside and press the top.
Cons: sometimes the powered coffee tends to sprinkle outside container while removing the top to stop. Solution, to stop keep the top pressed but disconnect the power.
The coffee grounds get stuck to the bottom and it's kinda loud. I have to wait til my kids wake up to use it. Overall good for the price, no doubt
Excellent Coffee Grinder and I like that this Coffee Grinder has additional parts for grinding other things too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great but coffee seeps under the bowl which is frustrating because it is difficult to clean plus that is wasted coffee
reviews.reviewText: Over a year now and still works great. The only thing I don't like is that coffee seeps under the bowl which is frustrating because it is very difficult to clean plus that is wasted coffee.

If you are serious coffee drinker and prefer to grind your own, choose a different product. Very messy machine. gets grinds all over the counter and the lid is difficult to get positioned and the grinder canister has a dangerously sharp edge. cut my finger twice.

reviews.reviewTitle: It really doesn't do that great a job on small quantities
reviews.reviewText: This is a larger grinder than I expected it to be. My husband chose this for grinding spices. It really doesn't do that great a job on small quantities, and some of the ground contents ended up underneath the bowl. I love kitchenaid stuff, but for our purposes, this isn't a winner.
Whatever I grind collects into the sides, this grinder is not well sealed. Not satisfied at all, waste of money.

On most grinders that I own the top part fits into the grinder cup, keeping everything neatly cobtained. With the grinder the cup goes over the outside and everything fly outside the cup and then into the base makeing it hard to clean.
I tried to ground peppercorns and it did a horrible job. At least half the peppercorns did not grind. The ones that did had an extremely course grind, not acceptable for cooking. Very disappointed in this product.

Great engineering. Much better than the Krups style and worth a few more $. Suspect that most of the Krups (and similar non-removable grinder) reviews haven't compared to this. The removable grinding bin makes it far more user friendly. Much easier to get the grinds out and clean. Also quiet and powerful. When the blades get dull can be replaced without throwing out the whole thing. As the Brit's' say- brilliant.

Didn't know what I was missing until I stumbled upon it by accident at my parents house.

reviews.reviewTitle: As easy to use and clean as they claim.
reviews.reviewText: Read the description and you'll see how specific KitchenAid is about how easy it is to use and clean. Two easy-to-remove parts that wash and rinse in just moments. Just press from 12 to 24 seconds for the precise grind your coffee maker needs.
I love KitchenAid products (who doesnt) and was excited to see this at a great price for Prime members. Works great and I expect it to last a long time.

I love this grinder. It's heavy duty, reliable and easy to clean. The capacity is great for doing large amounts but also handles smaller amounts great and I get a consistent grind every time. Highly recommend this grinder above any other at this price point.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far I am pleased with this product
reviews.reviewText: So far I am pleased with this product. It worked right out of the box. You just add coffee and press on top to grind. The drawbacks are, you have to learn to measure and you have to time it yourself. I am not picky or obsessed with coffee flavor, so to me it is always an adventure. Besides I always buy different kinds of coffee and make different amounts; so to me ii is not a big deal. This a well constructed grinder.
This coffee grinder works great. It looks nice too. It is a bit loud but not too bad. Definitely satisfied with product.

We've been using coffee grinders for years and I think this is our favorite so far! I really love the way it works and I can add more beans than the ones we've had in the past. I do want to see if there is a way to keep the ground coffee from falling under the removable container but it may be the way I'm using it.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you don't want to wake your spouse in the morning
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this as a gift for my wife for use on a daily basis. Here's the short and sweet of it:

Pros: quiet, fast, takes up minimal counter space, and is decorative.

Cons: none so far!

I was surprised at how fast the grinder works, and how relatively quiet it is. Dollar for dollar I'm glad I purchase this one over other, more pricey options. All in all you can't go wrong with this grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: you must hold it down while it grinds/blades wear out
reviews.reviewText: I thought this would be a powerful grinder which ground fast. You have to hold it down to make it fine for 45 seconds or more. You must also be careful not to overload it but use half the coffee it will hold. My old wimpy grinder is doing a better job in less time. Just trying to save time in the kitchen ..... As this grinder gets used it is not grinding as fine. I will buy a new grinder
Messy, the cup/lid does not seal properly and grinds fly all over the inside of the machine.

Very easy to clean. I've owned a couple cheaper grinders where the grinding chamber and blade were not separable from the drive electronics. This made it very difficult to fully clean them since preventing water from getting inside the electronics was crucial.

My only complaint is the top does not actually seal the grinding chamber so there's a small chance that some of the contents may escape the easily cleaned parts.

I bought this grinder to replace my old one, it's good quality product. I use it for drip and a percolator, I don't think it will make good espresso. The removable bowl is very convenient, I don't know why they did not come up with this design sooner! One flaw is that the blades sit too high from the bottom, thus ground coffee gets stuck between the bottom and the blades, so, you have to scoop it out. Not perfect, but functional

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple enought for a guy to use, robust, quiet and a perfect grind every time...
reviews.reviewText:
After a couple of decades of use, my old Chemex grinder finally wore holes in the collection shoot. It worked great but with holes in the basket, well, a replacement for an old standby had to be found. There are so many of these that seem to cost a lot and the reviews suggest they were designed by people who drank water, not coffee...
I took a chance on this one since it had a lot of good reviews. Now I know why, this works like a charm. It absolutely exceeded any expectation in terms of easy of use, quietness and so far, reliability.
Getting it dialed in to my taste took a couple of tries and now, it delivers exactly the grind I want.
What you'll like:

Robust and solid, heavy base doesn't move about
Clean, no spilling of anything
Quiet
Easy to use and clean
Consistent grind
Simple as it can be to use, even a guy like me can do it, boiling water is advanced cooking for me... Simply remove the lid, rotate the stainless basket to unlock and remove, fill with beans, lock basket in place, add cover and grind.

The minuses?

Not very significant but here is what I found could be improved on:

1. Graduated Markings on the inside of the cup for the beans were virtually useless, you can't see them. Buy a press that puts big marks inside the basket guys. I used a center punch to create a series of bumps I could actually see.
2. Would be nice to have a way to set a time to grind but counting one Mississippi, two Mississipi works so it's a minor point.
It is worth the money it is relatively quiet. The only complaint I have is that it can be hard to get all of the ground coffee out of the bottom
We use for the drip coffee maker. Nice even grinds, easy to keep clean. Very durable, it should last a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Going Back to My Cheap Model
reviews.reviewText: Good blades and beautiful design, but really faulty. The gap between the cup and the lid allows the coffee to escape. It makes a mess every time you use it. I'm really disappointed, after 5 years using a cheap Cadence model, never thought that a KitchenAid product could be "inferior". To be fair, it is way better build, but appears that the people who built it never use it.

A couple years ago, when we lost power for a week in the late fall, we started using an old campfire type coffee percolator. We found the flavor to be so much better than run-of-the-mill drip type coffee makers. Well, we recently tried fresh ground coffee by trying to use a blender. Needless to say, that didn't work out so well. We decided to purchase a REAL coffee grinder and are glad we did. MUCH smoother flavor than using pre-ground coffee.
A little finicky on the grinding; takes some user practice. But, works great overall for a basic grinder without any bells and whistles. Would recommend.

A very sturdy grinder, I have been using it everyday for a month, super quite and fast. I like super fine coffee for a drip pot and this does the job and the grinder lifts off the motor so you can dump it out with worry of the blade turning on ! Great Price, First Quality.
Great product. It grinds coffee beans in just a couple presses on the lid. This is my first one so I cant compare it to others but I am loving the ease of it plus it looks nice on the counter.

I got this grinder for my hubby for x-mas and we love it!! It is quick, reasonably quiet and easy to use. We use it for grinding beans for our French press so we are not looking for super fine but I'm sure it could do it. It grinds really quickly, it is easy to remove the cup with the ground coffee in it and pour it out with out a mess. It is easy to clean up and doesn't have tons of parts to mess around with. We use it every day and have had no problems so far in the month we have used it. I would recommend it to a friend for sure :)

reviews.reviewTitle: It looks good  but looks are deceiving!
reviews.reviewText: I am very unhappy with this coffee grinder. Time got away for me, but I shouldve returned it! To begin with, its not easy to line up the cup holding the beans with the grinder so that it will engage. In use, the grinder is designed so that coffee grounds fly up against the cover and fall back down into the gear mechanism. Also, after use, the coffee is ground fine on the bottom and coarse on top. I do not recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Well worth the price over the Competition
reviews.reviewText: Everyone who uses it here comments on how quiet and efficient it is. Washing is a breeze, the grinder comes out for the dishwasher. Really well designed and built product, well worth the very few dollars more than the cheaper competition. It's also quite attractive. Highly recommended.

I absolutely love my new coffee grinder, and it's a first for me, too! It's super simple to use, too! Just add your coffee beans of your choice, secure all the parts beforehand, put the cover on, and press and hold down for less than 25 seconds and grind away!

Love this new coffee bean grinder! I was a little nervous the first time using it b/c I didn't know how long to grind the beans for my stove top percolator but the instructions were good and I like holding the grinder top down for 8 seconds for larger grounds and 10 seconds for a little finer grind. I think I'm going to be very happy with this beauty!
This grinder works great. It has a large stainless steel container with measurements on the side so you know how much you have ground. The overall quality and ease of use is great.

reviews.reviewTitle: A useful product for the coffee bean users.
reviews.reviewText: Bought the product a while ago since my brother kept giving the wife and I coffee beans as presents. Normally, we get ground coffee, but this product grinds the beans completely and in less than five minutes. Easy to use and easy to clean. A must have if you prefer grinding your own coffee beans.

reviews.reviewTitle: I am well satisfied with this appliance
reviews.reviewText: I am well satisfied with this appliance....I had the previous version of it and still use it and this new one meets my expectations also. It is easy to use, has a larger capacity than other kinds I have used and is powerful enough for grains as well as coffee.

I just started drinking coffee again, and I must say fresh ground coffee makes a HUGE difference!! I bought this grinder in particular because it was stainless steel, which I'm a fan of. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: when brewing in my Keurig it the coffee comes out horrible. Tried various times and consistencies of the ground ...
reviews.reviewText:
My former coffee grinder blade broke after at least 15 years of use.
Purchased this one, after reading reviews of all. Does not grind coffee
well at all, when brewing in my Keurig it the coffee comes out horrible.
Tried various times and consistencies of the ground coffee, didn't
matter. Never got a good cup of coffee using this Coffee grinder.
Very disappointed.

This is the best coffee grinder I have ever owned, by far. The design is outstanding - quiet, efficient, lovely to look at, and without the flaws of my previous ones. The container for the beans comes out easily, and the ground coffee pours out without sticking or flying everywhere. My husband and I use different coffemakers - french press for me, Mr. Coffee drip for him - and we are both satisfied with the grinds. I hope it lasts a very long time.

I use this grinder for my coffee every day. It doesn't allow you to control how fine the coffee beans are ground but I still find my coffee comes out perfectly and it saves me spending ages using the hand grinder I have.
Did not like how product worked so I returned it. Wouldn't purchase again. Grinding was not easy with this product. Have to really pay attn.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great and I love that I can remove the cup ...
reviews.reviewText: Works great and I love that I can remove the cup from the grinder! It makes it easier to pour the grounds out and clean it as well. That feature alone makes it worth more to me than other grinders. Would definitely recommend.
How was this such a great deal?!? It grinds my coffee- all stainless steel! Hefty and feels long lasting.
Works perfectly. Super convenient and easy to use. Noise level is about what you would expect from a coffee grinder...

I shopped for weeks looking for the perfect grinder that wasn't ridiculously expensive. For once I made the right choice the first time. It ill grind your coffee beans as coarse or as fine as you want them to be. It is also VERY quiet. You won't waked up everyone grinding coffee beans in the morning. The only con is that you will almost always spill coffee on your counter.

The longevity of the safety actuator pins is a question but the grinding power, construction makes this device a great choice at the ~$20 price range.
We are using this to grind mixed nuts and coffee.

So convenient and such a time saver!!! The large capacity makes it simple and quick to grind as many coffee beans as necessary. The straight, flat top design keeps the mess to a minimum, unlike the rounded designs of so many other products. Wonderful grinder!
bought to grind spices for my sausage/meat creations. Works great in blending the spices, making them easier to disburse in my meat products. Real happy with it.

What a great purchase. Made my coffee taste so much better, and the removable stainless steel bowl is the best part. A lot of similar products are all one piece. The ability to remove the bowl to pour the ground coffee into the coffee machine, and wash separately from the grinder (and motor) is absolutely necessary. Kitchenaid thought this one through and executed well.

reviews.reviewTitle: A lot simpler than most coffee grinders. A little ...
reviews.reviewText: A lot simpler than most coffee grinders. A little bit escapes over the top ledge inside though. And it can't handle anything wet very well at all, in case you were hoping (I found it disappointing). It's decent though.
The longer you grind, the finer the grain. Grinding takes very little effort.

This grinder does a good job of grinding up my beans. The only issue I have with it is that the grounds on the bottom get stuck and have to be "swept" out of the device. It is easiest to do with your finger rotating the blades, but is obviously not very safe. This means you have to either unplug the device to properly dump your grinds, or keep something handy around. It should be part of the design that you can simply dump out the grounds. Still gave 4 starts
Takes awhile to process a lb. Of coffee but it works good so far.
Heavy duty-well built. Easy to use-easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... use this as a spice grinder and it is horribly ineffective. It leaks spices everywhere and takes forever ...
reviews.reviewText: I tried to use this as a spice grinder and it is horribly ineffective. It leaks spices everywhere and takes forever to grind them. I grind all of my spices from seeds or whole dried peppers (i.e cumin, allspice, clove, guajillo peppers, chile de arbol, etc). Do not buy this if you are intending to use it as a spice grinder!!
Works better than most others I have purchased over the years. Grinds quickly and very well.

My main objective in finding a new coffee grinder was that it had its own removable cup that holds the coffee. Nothing more annoying than having to turn your grinder upside down to pour all the beans out once their ground!! So messy!!! But not this little charmer... It's clean stainless steel cup releases with just a twist, making it easy to then pour the beans in the coffee pot for brewing. Not to mention easier cleaning!!! On top of its neatness, it's also a provides a great grind for the beans, and is moderately quiet. My last grinder was a Cuisinart, and this little KitchenAid beauty is certainly quieter than that one!

reviews.reviewTitle: Fine grinder but a step down from the model it replaces
reviews.reviewText: Sleek design, sturdily constructed but grinds slower than my 10 year old KitchenAid grinder and the plastic top is shaped so it cannot be set down without it falling over (due to the protruding lower lip).
Good value for a simple to use grinder. Does what we expect it to do.
This is an awesome product. I bought because I dropped my previous coffee grinder. Grinds great so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty good grinder with an few caveats
reviews.reviewText: I like the solid build of the grinder and the detachable chamber. Only complaint is that when you grind the beans, the grinds fly up and get in between the chamber and the cover wall. Because of this its really easy to get coffee grinds underneath the chamber so I have to end up cleaning it out constantly. I think this is just due to poor design.
This is a super nice grinder. MIgt buy one for myself!

It's just okay. Makes a mess. The grounds leak and get all over the counter because they get caked up on the lip of the grinder. Grinds unevenly, too. I do not drink coffee, but I use coffee beans and other plant matter that I need to have ground into powders. It is cheaper in most cases to buy the whole dried plant material and grind it yourself, and I read in one review that this was good enough for espresso grade grounds. Not the case. My picture was take after I received the grinder, washed it and then tried to use it. I was grinding dandelion roots. A lot of powder gets into the air and caked onto the top, as well. Should probably wear a mask when using this to avoid breathing in anything.

Update (4/8/2016): HATE IT!!! Huge mess under the grinding cup. This thing sucks. Even more mess to clean up. Going back to hand-grinding all my beans and herbs.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like this coffee grinder and will keep it but am ...
reviews.reviewText: I like this coffee grinder and will keep it but am giving 4 stars because even after much longer than the suggested time the manual suggests to grind coffee beans, there are still some large pieces of coffee bean left amongst the finer grounds. This doesn't really bother me enough to return it but I feel it should be mentioned as I wouldn't expect this to happen with a KitchenAid product.

Arrived well packaged and timely too. Tried it immediately so very quiet grinding the beans. Thank you
Mama Coffee Connoisseur Snob

reviews.reviewTitle: Extracts full flavor for maximum taste.
reviews.reviewText: This was an excellent grinder. I recently was using a simple Krups grinder and could not get my coffee to taste good at all. I decided to look into something with better reviews and I found this KitchenAid grinder and I have to say that it extracts the flavor from the coffee beans as it should. Finally some delicious coffee after soo many fails. I would highly recommend this product. It's affordable too.

I really like this grinder. It is simply designed and easy to use and clean. The only potential issue that I could see it is that it typically allows the fine grounds to settle to the bottom leaving more coarse grounds towards the top, but it doesn't bother me at all. My coffee tastes good either way. I would definitely recommend this to a friend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder but a little messy
reviews.reviewText: Doesnt make a tight seal with there being a small but significant gap between the clear top but works perfectly. Except the coffee grounds all over my counter when I take the lid off.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better than the Hamilton Beach ones
reviews.reviewText: This has a nice design, with a removable grinding chamber. The design avoids the cover breakage problem that plagues the HB ones. You have to hold down the top to grind, but this turns out not to be a big inconvenience. The oilier beans that I use (dark roasts) sometimes get clumped in the bottom of the grinding chamber, and have to be dislodged (firm taps with the palm of the hand usually do the job).

title: KitchenAid BCG111OB Blade Coffee Grinder - Onyx Black
features:
Make sure this fits
                by entering your model number.
Stainless steel blade to grind whole beans for a rich, aromatic blend
The whole grinder is remarkably easy to clean
The bowl, blade and top cover can go straight to the dishwasher for easy cleanup

qAndA.question: Will this grinder grind flax seed?
qAndA.answer: Yes we grind flax seed and chia in it for our smoothies. The little metal cup is easy to clean so you can grind coffee one day and flax the next and not get any flavor cross over.

qAndA.question: how much coffee will it grind at one time? (i.e. what's the maximum capacity?)
qAndA.answer: The metal grinding bowl is lined with measurement in which 12 0z is the max or 1 1/2 cups.

qAndA.question: is the inside of the grinder metal or plastic?
qAndA.answer: Stainless steel. It's the best grinder I've had. I highly recommend it!

qAndA.question: How long should you grind for a espresso (fine) grind? At the min 4 cup line?
qAndA.answer: Hi Amanda, Well I've had more time with my KA grinder since I wrote that review. I'm still pleased with the way it operates but have come to realize that grinding times need to be longer than the directions call for. I, too favor a fine grind so have been holding the grinding to a count of twenty (one one thousand, see more

qAndA.question: Can you use this to grind ginger or garlic?
qAndA.answer: Because of the type of blade, and the design of the grinder, it's not meant to grind spices. Only coffee. That said, I have only used mine for coffee, and have not tried anything else. You'll find that most of the negative reviews are from users who had difficulty with grinding spices. I would recommend shopping sp see more

qAndA.question: Is there room for power cord storage in the unit? If not, is it a removable cord?
qAndA.answer: No and no. The cord is permanent and approx. 18 inches.

qAndA.question: Is this 110-220v, or only for use in the US / Canada?
qAndA.answer: It is a 120 volt appliance, for use in the US.

qAndA.question: Is this grinder works on 220v
qAndA.answer: very goob

qAndA.question: Will this grind coarse beans for French press?
qAndA.answer: It will grind coarse if you don't grind too long.. Not sure why the other reviewer said no. It even says so in the instructions.

qAndA.question: What is the wattage? Normally it's 150 or 200 watts.
qAndA.answer: 170w and the best coffee grinder I have ever used!

qAndA.question: can you pre-set grind size to fine, medium, etc...?
qAndA.answer: M. Brice

qAndA.question: Can you grind less than the minimum recommended amount? Sometimes I only want to grind 2 tablespoons of beans.
qAndA.answer: while I have not ground that amount it seems like it would be no problem. the blades are close to the bottom, they move fast and I think it would grind as little as a single bean I really like this grinder.

qAndA.question: What grade is the stainless steel?
qAndA.answer: Very high grade I like it very well one one best grinders I have ever had!

qAndA.question: Do you sell this product in 220 volts in amazon us?
qAndA.answer: Answer not available

qAndA.question: retractable
qAndA.answer: If "retractable" refers to the power cord retracting within the unit, the answer is no. Our stainless steel finish grinder has a thick black power cord of 2 1/2 feet long.

qAndA.question: Krups is good but wears out with daily use? Is this brand better?
qAndA.answer: We use ours about once a week to grind all the coffee needed for the week. It seems to be working just fine and not slowing down.

qAndA.question: For 4 to 8 cups of coffee, do we fill ground beans to that line then use it all? It looked like too much? I usually use 1 tbls per 2 cups.
qAndA.answer: Personal preference for how strong you like it plus what type of coffee you're using ... probably take some trial & error

qAndA.question: I want to grind enough coffee to make just ONE cup. I don't want to grind enough coffee for FOUR cups to get my one cup. Why not have a smaller bowl for this?
qAndA.answer: So, why not grind enough beans for one cup? Bowl size shouldn't matter. People use varying amounts of beans for coffee strength and that works. I would guess a little less than 1 tablespoon of beans should work. Just experiment. Had another thought, why not grind enough for more than one cup at a time and store gr see more

qAndA.question: Can it grind sea moss into a fine powder?
qAndA.answer: O believed so

qAndA.question: Brand new and I can't remove the bowl. I twisted it counter-clockwise per the instructions and it won't budge. Is there a trick to it?
qAndA.answer: No it's very simple, grab the bottom with right hand and use the left to hold onto metal cylinder and twist counterclockwise. It is not screwed into threads so it should turn about an inch. If it's stuck see if you can press downward while turning.

qAndA.question: Use 220v?
qAndA.answer: No mine is 110

qAndA.question: Can you do a course grind?
qAndA.answer: The less time you engage the grinder the more course. I count about 15 seconds and use in a press.

qAndA.question: In the pictures there are beans everywhere, Why is this machine so messy?
qAndA.answer: I don't know about the picture but I have not had any spillage to date. The grounds do have to be coaxed out of the cup with a small silicon scraper. The only negative is that the grinder switch is temperamental at times.

qAndA.question: Can I make ginger garlic paste with this?
qAndA.answer: What about this KRUPS F203 Electric Spice and Coffee Grinder with Stainless Steel Blades, 3-Ounce, Black

qAndA.question: why the instruction manual says, "not recommended using this grinder to grind beans for for pump expresso-type machines"?
qAndA.answer: Answer not available

qAndA.question: What is the input voltage on the grinder?
Is this able to grind beans fine enough for espresso?
qAndA.answer: Yes. Mine works just fine for espresso.

qAndA.question: I just got this grinder and used it for the first time this morning. Coffee grinds went all over the place. Did I just get a lemon?
qAndA.answer: as long as the metal cup that holds the coffee is snapped correctly in place and you hold the top down when grinding it should stay in the metal container. I never have had a problem like that. Mine works great

qAndA.question: Can be used for other seeds
qAndA.answer: Probably but don't think I'd try it. Difficulty grinding coffee beans.

qAndA.question: HI everyone, the product description isn't very good on this one. Can someone tell me whether the cord is stowed within the grinder?
qAndA.answer: No. It is a rather thick cord, but only 2 feet or so long.

qAndA.question: What is the current type? 100/240? 110v only? 220?
What is the replacement blade part number?
qAndA.answer: Sorry, I do not know the answer. Try the manufacturer's web site maybe?

qAndA.question: Is this grinder easy to clean? Does it leave a mess on the counter after grinding?
qAndA.answer: No mess and seldom needs cleaning.

qAndA.question: how power for it work it use batery,batery recharge or electric power plugin 110v
qAndA.answer: Only uses 110volt AC plug in

qAndA.question: How does the metal container seal to the plastic top?
qAndA.answer: It lines up and you push down on it to grind the coffee. It's the best grinder I've found. I actually bought this one for my daughter. I've had mine for several years.

qAndA.question: Is it hands free
qAndA.answer: You just have to push down on top to activate as was stated before, I have found it easy to use and works great

qAndA.question: Has Kitchen Aid improved this so the plastic gears don't wear out quickly? I loved this machine for flaxseed but disappointed in the gear quality.
qAndA.answer: Still the same as far as I know but certainly had not negatively impacted the results. Consumers Report listed them as top machine and I have found it so, Honestly, having to replace at high quality machine as this is I am reminded that it was also the cheapest - under $20.

qAndA.question: hi! is this 220v , to use in Argentina? thanks!
qAndA.answer: No. You'll have to use a voltage converter.

qAndA.question: Will this model grind for espresso?
qAndA.answer: I love my grinder! I use it daily. You just leave it in longer to get a fine grind. I really love my coffee grinder!!!!!

qAndA.question: Is the plastic lid BPA free ?
qAndA.answer: I am not sure, but it is the type of hard, clear plastic that usually does not contain BPA. It is not a worry for me since there is no chance of any BPA leeching out. It rarely comes in contact with the coffee and there is no liquid involved. In fact, the lid usually remains completely clean after grinding. This is see more

qAndA.question: Is this good for wet grinding? Like cashew paste or baby foods.
qAndA.answer: I have not tried wet grinding but is wonderful for coffee. I would think it would work for wet also.

qAndA.question: Hilo I want 220v
qAndA.answer: Answer not available

qAndA.question: How long does it take to grind?
qAndA.answer: You should vary the grind time based on the amount of beans. For beans at the 8 mark I grind 22 seconds, pulsing it for the last four.

qAndA.question: Is this grinder 110/220? Or just 110.
qAndA.answer: 110v only

qAndA.question: Does it grind coarsely for a French Press or only the fine grind for a drip
qAndA.answer: I've never used a French press, but I if you just grind 5 seconds instead of the ten or so for extra fine grind it would be coarser. Hope this helps. My grandmother used an old antique hand grinder which was perfect for coarse. A 1938 model probably, the year she got married. Good luck.

qAndA.question: how power for it work it use batery ,batery recharge, or electric power plugin
qAndA.answer: Electric plug

qAndA.question: Has Kitchen Aid improved this so the plastic gears don't wear out quickly? I loved this machine for flaxseed but disappointed in the gear quality.
qAndA.answer: I can only answer your question if this wears out. It has not done so and, consequently, I am more than pleased with its performance Plus it's cost.

qAndA.question: does it have a retractable cord?

qAndA.question: Can this grinder process raw fruits and vegetables? Looking to use this to make baby food.

qAndA.answer:
I did not use it for ice, just coffee, some spices and it is excellent.
I am afraid the blade will be damaged when crushing ice.

qAndA.question: Is this grinder quiet?

qAndA.question: Do the blades spin in the same direction as the unlock direction for the bowl? I've had problems with bowls unlocking during grinding.
qAndA.answer: No. The bowl unlocks by twisting left and the blades spin to the right. I've been using it daily for a couple of weeks now with no problem.

qAndA.question: Is it bivolt?
qAndA.answer: Not sure what "bivolt" means but I assume you're asking if it can operate on current other than standard US current. It comes with a standard US cord with no transformer, so I would not use it in any other situation. By the way, it is a great coffee grinder.

qAndA.question: Does it work well for a pour over?
qAndA.answer: It just grinds up the beans. If you use grounds for a pour over, this magically creates grounds from whole beans

qAndA.question: Will this work with 240 V supply?
qAndA.answer: NO ! However, if you first plug the coffee grinder into a power transformer Frist, it will work.

qAndA.question: Is it normal to have to slam down the top for the grinder to operate?
qAndA.answer: Not for me. I just press and hold till its ground

qAndA.question: does this have a removeable cup for easy cleaning?
qAndA.answer: Yes! Very easy to clean

qAndA.question: Can I use the grinder for either coffee, nuts or spices with the same blade? Or does it have a blade for each purpose?
qAndA.answer: Don't know. Didn't research that on the web since I only bought it for coffee.

qAndA.question: Has anyone used this grinder for their Toddy system and did it produce too much fine dust?
qAndA.answer: I don't know what a Toddy system is, but I use 6 scoops of coffee and run for 21 seconds. There is some finely ground coffee that accumulates under the blades.

qAndA.question: Can this be used to make almond flour as well?
qAndA.answer: I make cashew 'flour' with it or cashew meal would be more accurate, using raw cashew pieces. If I grind it longer it almost turns to 'cashew butter' but sticks to the sides so doesn't complete the process. I have not tried almonds in it but it will not grind walnuts unless they are already in small pieces. I use this  see more

qAndA.question: Can you grind rice to make rice flour?
qAndA.answer: No. I have grind rice for other purpose (for a Chinese dish ???). It cannot grind rice to fine powder like flour. You might looking into Vitamix for grinding rice for rice flour.

qAndA.question: How easy is it to operate? Will it work with arthritic hands?
qAndA.answer: I find it easy to operate and I 'think' you could work it with arthritic hands. You don't have to press the button at the top to operate as you can use your whole hand to press down the top. It might be hard for you to twist the 'bowl' off of its bass in order to wash it, but you could simply wipe out the inside of t see more

qAndA.question: Can it grind the beans to a "dust"? I use an ibrik sometimes and it requires dust consistency.
